gov.usgs.anss.util

Class Subprocess

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.util.Subprocess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class Subprocess
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class really wraps the Process class providing simple err and output processing. It executes a command using the Runtime.getRuntime().exec() function as a subprocess which could still be running after construction. It facilitates getting the returned stderr and stdout as strings and allows for a waitFor(). It mainly is used to hide the details of getting the err and output from the users and the details of process control. It prevents OS dependent lock ups if stdout and stderr have lots of output and need to be relieved. This Class extends thread and the run() method is emptying the stderr and stdout every 0.1 seconds and exiting when it discovers the subprocess has exited. The waitFor() not only waits for the subprocess to exit, but insures the run() has exited insuring the stdout and stdin buffers are complete before returning.

      • run

        public void run()
        This is implemented as a Thread so that it will keep reading any stderr or stdout input into the StringBuffers so that they cannot block the operating system from running the subprocess. Read any input each 1/10th second and exits when the subprocess has exited.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

        Returns:
        the InputStream which gets the output

      • waitFor

        public int waitFor()
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this subprocess to exit. This suspends the current thread until the subprocess is done so be careful that the subprocess does not dead lock or run continuously.
        Returns:
        Exit value of process, zero is success, -99 means it is still running.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Means wait did not complete but was interrupted

      • waitFor

        public int waitFor(long timeoutMS)
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this subprocess to exit. This suspends the current thread until the subprocess is done so be careful that the subprocess does not dead lock or run continuously.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMS - the maximum number of millis to wait before aborting. Return -99
        Returns:
        Exit value of process, zero is success.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Means wait did not complete but was interrupted

      • waitFor

        public int waitFor(long timeoutMS,
                   EdgeThread log)
            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Wait for this subprocess to exit. This suspends the current thread until the subprocess is done so be careful that the subprocess does not dead lock or run continuously.
        Parameters:
        timeoutMS - the maximum number of millis to wait before aborting. Return -99
        log - The EdgeThread to us for loggin, it must not be null.
        Returns:
        Exit value of process, zero is success.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Means wait did not complete but was interrupted

      • exitValue

        public int exitValue()
        Returns the exit status of the subprocess. If the subprocess is still running this should return -99 to indicate it is still running and so can be used to test for the process still running without blocking the thread's execution
        Returns:
        The exit status of the subprocess or -99 if the subprocess is still running

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.String getOutput()
        return the output of the subprocess as a string. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stdout to this point, but will not block.
        Returns:
        String with the contents of stdout

      • getOutput

        public java.lang.String getOutput(boolean clear)
        return the output of the subprocess as a string. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stdout to this point, but will not block. if flag is true, clear the output buffer
        Parameters:
        clear - If true, clear the output buffer after getting the string
        Returns:
        String with the contents of stdout

      • getErrorOutput

        public java.lang.String getErrorOutput()
        return error output to date of the subprocess. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stderr to this point, but will not block.
        Returns:
        String with contents of stderr

      • getErrorOutput

        public java.lang.String getErrorOutput(boolean clear)
        return error output to date of the subprocess. If the subprocess is still running, it may return some portion of the stderr to this point, but will not block.
        Parameters:
        clear - If true, clear the text field after returning it
        Returns:
        String with contents of stderr
